title: Weird dependency resolution error
body:
This command

```
spack install -j1 -v cactusext +funhpc +simulationio %gcc@6.1.0-spack
```

leads to this error from Spack:

```
==> Error: Multiple providers found for 'mpi': ['openmpi%gcc@6.1.0-spack~pmi+verbs', 'openmpi@1.10.2%gcc@6.1.0-spack~pmi~psm~tm+verbs=linux-x86_64^hwloc@1.11.3%gcc@6.1.0-spack=linux-x86_64^libpciaccess@0.13.4%gcc@6.1.0-spack=linux-x86_64^libsigsegv@2.10%gcc@6.1.0-spack=linux-x86_64^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@6.1.0-spack=linux-x86_64^m4@1.4.17%gcc@6.1.0-spack+sigsegv=linux-x86_64']
```

After adding some line breaks, this becomes

```
openmpi%gcc@6.1.0-spack~pmi+verbs

openmpi@1.10.2%gcc@6.1.0-spack~pmi~psm~tm+verbs=linux-x86_64
    ^hwloc@1.11.3%gcc@6.1.0-spack=linux-x86_64
    ^libpciaccess@0.13.4%gcc@6.1.0-spack=linux-x86_64
    ^libsigsegv@2.10%gcc@6.1.0-spack=linux-x86_64
    ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@6.1.0-spack=linux-x86_64
    ^m4@1.4.17%gcc@6.1.0-spack+sigsegv=linux-x86_64
```

I see that the first (essentially `openmpi +verbs`) is what I specify, and the second is what one obtains naturally after adding all dependencies, versions, and architectures. I don't see where the conflict comes from.

How do I debug this? I realize this involves some packages of mine that are only available in my branch of Spack (see https://github.com/eschnett/spack/tree/eschnett/cactusext). Is there a particular routine to look at, or some debug output that would trace Spack's dependency resolution mechanism?
